dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The person who died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You'll like Dr. Chung. This is only my second session, but she's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a patient.     I'm her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee lifts her veil and looks at Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.     I can see the resemblance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to make me sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus shoots Malee a look just as Yacco exits her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Maitland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus rises and enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) I'll be with you in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco crosses to Malee and sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) So, how was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a funeral, Mom.     How do you think it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I couldn't make it. Let Rudy's parents know I'm available if they need to talk. I won't charge for the sessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee looks to Yacco, stunned by her comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) You know, it's okay to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's okay to cry. I don't need you to tell me, it's okay to cry. If I want to cry, I'll cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco re-enters her office.       A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars fill the driveway and line the street in front of Jacob's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mourners stand in small groups, engaged in hushed conversations. Jim sits in his recliner, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of MOTHERS watch as Ashley obsessively prepares platter of deviled eggs. Concerned, one of them crosses o to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, there's more than enough food here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Rudy loved my deviled eggs. It's right that I make them. Where's the paprika?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley opens up her cupboards in search of the paprika.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHLEY (CONT'D) (cont'd) Jesus, you put something down, and it disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now angry, Ashley starts throwing objects out of the cupboards, haphazardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley slams her cupboard doors shut. She looks around an spots the GARBAGE PAIL across the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I threw it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley crosses to the garbage. She lifts it upside down a dumps the trash all over the floor. Ashley gets on her kn and starts searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other women look to each other, uncomfortable.     Mo 1 kneels down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley ignores her. Mother # 1 grabs Ashley's hands and looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stops cold.     The grief and heartache hit once a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHLEY (CONT'D) (cont'd) Not my baby! Please God not my son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mothers collectively drop to the floor and surround Ashley in an attempt to comfort her. They give no care to the pile of garbage they now sit in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard lies in a bed, staring out the window. There is a BANDAGE wrapped around his forehead. Patrick sits beside in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace enters, carrying bags of MCDONALD'S food with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hospital is a nightmare. The elevator is never there when you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick crosses over to the food and grabs his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley took Sara up to the maternity ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace crosses over to Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky you didn't get killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You try being awakened at four o'clock in the morning by the police saying, they have your son, he's unconscious and on his way to the hospital. I've never been so scared in my life. And poor Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best friend is dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace hands Leonard a double cheeseburger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat this.    It'll make you feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. Besides, I can't taste anything anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital food is always bland. This has flavor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's because of my condition. I can't taste or smell anything anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, condition? What condition?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) My condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Grace sit across from the DOCTOR (50's).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard has a condition.    It's called Anosmia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!     Is it serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Anosmia is when a person looses their sense of smell. It's not uncommon in patients who suffer serious head injuries. Unfortunately, it's also affecting his ability to taste. Again, not uncommon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it permanent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on the patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? He can't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can eat. He just can't taste what he's eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she means is, he won't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard's association with food is no longer about taste. It's about texture. While we may be partial to sweet or salty foods, Leonard will become partial to crunchy or smooth ones. Once he settles on a texture he likes, his appetite will increase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering what Leonard could have suffered, he's lucky. Besides, he is severely overweight. A loss of appetite may be a benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Patrick shoot him a look of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard lies in bed, staring out the window. A NURSE (40) enters and crosses over to his bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse sees that Leonard has barely touched his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NURSE (CONT'D) (cont'd) You have to eat something. It may not be gourmet, but you don't look that finicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stuff feels like shit in my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's macaroni and cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels gross. Like there's a film on my tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse grabs the tray of food. She removes an untouche apple and places it in Leonard's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (CONT'D) (cont'd) I don't like apples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you can't taste it, right? Maybe you'll like the crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse exits. Leonard eyes the apple in his hand. A beat. He reluctantly takes a bite. The apple makes a loud CRUNCH. Leonard starts chewing. After a few seconds, a smile comes to his face. He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob lies in bed, holding Rudy's old baseball GLOVE. He brings the glove to his nose, and a flood of old memories come back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob rises, crosses over to the closet and removes a met LOCK BOX. He selects 666 for the combination and the box opens. Jacob removes the contents; baseball cards, some firecrackers, a few ticket stubs and a PHOTOGRAPH of he a Rudy at age 5. He can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe Artunian crosses over to Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, Jim.    Again, so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gabe turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, are you still interested in buying the land? Because I accept your offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is hardly the time to talk business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy the woods, Gabe, please. Tear them down and build. Build houses, condos, a 7-11, I don't care. I just don't want to recognize it ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Gabe's look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a CHAIN SAW chopping down a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDEN to REVEAL a CONSTRUCTION CREW, tearing down the las the woods. Rows and rows of STUMPS make it look like a graveyard for trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone!     It's all gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FIND Malee and Jacob, straddling their bikes a few fee away from the site. Leonard is beside them on a scooter. as a band-aid on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) If Rudy was alive, he'd be freaking out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard shoots Malee a look.    She silences herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You holding up alright, Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (CONT'D) (cont'd) I'm sorry. I wish I could have done something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff and Kenny were the ones that started the fire. It was their fault. Or maybe mine. I should of been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have been able to do anything. And it could have been you who died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it was. You know the last thing Rudy said to me? He said, I can't be a pussy all my life. He was right, I am. And Rudy might be dead because of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. (beat) Why don't you talk to your parents about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give them time. It'll get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't? My dad hasn't gone back to work yet. What if he loses his job. We could lose our house. I could be homeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're best friends.    We...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, something catches Malee's attention off screen. It's GUS, standing beside a BULLDOZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy. I like know him. He's one of my mother's patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen a patient of hers actually out and about. (beat) Should we go over and say "hi"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard and Jacob start heading off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee stays for a beat, eyeing Gus as he removes his T-sh and exposes his rock abs. She is obviously turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming, Malee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard enters to find Grace, placing a casserole dish on table. The table is filled with a cornucopia of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we having company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is all for you. Your favorites; fried chicken, spaghetti, pizza, french fries, and chocolate cheesecake for dessert. I made everything extra spicy, so you can taste it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, it doesn't matter how spicy the food is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're not even gonna try it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.     Don't eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace puts the plate of food into the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) You can't just eat apples all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, searching) It's unhealthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Leonard's confusion -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students make their way inside for the first day of schoo There is a sign out front, which reads: WELCOME BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TEACHER walks along the line of desks, showing students their assigned seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy Wallace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHER (CONT'D) (cont'd) Jacob Carges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHER (CONT'D) (cont'd) Rudy Carges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob along with his classmates are shocked to discover t Rudy's name hasn't been removed from the attendance sheet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher is unaware of the mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHER (CONT'D) (cont'd) Rudy Carges. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy looks to Jacob.       Since Rudy's not saying anyth will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not in this class anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize being new at this school puts me at a disadvantage, but joking about a fellow classmate's death is anything but funny, Mr....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher checks her attendance sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEACHER (cont'd) ...Carges.     Wait, are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his brother. Was.     And I'm not joking. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teacher looks around at the other students, realizing Jacob is telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. Wow, this is awkward. Would you like the seat left empty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jacob's look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH GILMORE (55), overweight, gym teacher, dressed in a jogging suit, snaps gum while addressing his students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class of boys stand up against the wall.    Leonard i amongst them. His gym uniform barely fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, ladies, welcome to gym. We will be starting things off this year with the United States Standardized Fitness Test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire class groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) I'm sure you all remember it from last year. I will be testing you in a number of physical fitness areas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As coach speaks, Leonard looks as if he's going to throw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STUDENT performs chin ups with great ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The state's requirement for upper body strength is ten chin ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The student finishes his run with a count of twelve.   He off the bar and crosses over to his classmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard, you're up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard crosses to the chin-up bar, grabs a hold of it an begins struggling to lift himself up. Unfortunately, he c only manage 1/8th of an inch. Leonard drops off the bar, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) What are you doing, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was as far as I could pull myself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few students laugh.        Coach shakes his head, disgu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach stands over the boy, timing him with a stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds. You need forty to pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The student increases his speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) Time.   42.     Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The student rises off the mat and walks over to the other boys. Leonard enters frame and drops on the mat like a to of bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) (rolling his eyes) Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard struggles to lift himself up but, he can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) Come on, son, fight it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard's face turns red. He clenches his teeth. Unfortunately, due to the pressure he is exerting, he blo loud fart. The gym erupts with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach and his students stand at the beginning of the track, waiting for Leonard to finish his laps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard slowly walks over.           He is soaking wet an heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goal was 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class can't help but laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) Hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (cont'd) Not you Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard turns back and crosses over to the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) Center. That's the position you'll be playing in two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like football?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. It's just I'll never make the weight requirement. Pop Warner league wouldn't let me play for five years because of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no weight requirement in high school ball, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach bends down and rifles through his GYM BAG.    H removes 2 books and hands them to Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COACH (CONT'D) (cont'd) These are your new bibles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One is on nutrition, the other exercise. You do what they say, and you can play for me once you get to high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard begins walking back to the gym.    After a few st he stops and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (CONT'D) (cont'd) Coach, why are you doing this for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've never seen a child so out of shape in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school BAND is on stage and playing a particularly horrendous rendition of the STAR SPANGLED BANNER. We FIND MALEE in the flute section, playing her heart out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CONDUCTOR, MR. FARMER (40) overly energetic and dorky waves his baton, silencing the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Did anyone practice over the summer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band sits silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Well, we still have a fall recital coming up. If anyone would like to perform a solo, sign up on the sheet outside my office. Class dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Malee, weighing the decision in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee stands outside Mr. Farmer's office, staring at the UP SHEET on his door. After a beat, she lifts her pen to sign her name. Before she writes it, she stops, quickly turns around and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Malee returns to the sign up sheet and star writing her name. Halfway through, she stops, scratches o her name and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We remain on the sign up sheet. After a few seconds, Male hand enters the shot and writes in her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters to find Jim and Ashley fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're wrong.    Call them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, I talked to the lawyer.   He wouldn't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had gone to the hearings like I said, this wouldn't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We agreed it would be too painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley turns to Jacob as if realizing his presence for th first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him.    Tell your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys who killed Rudy cut a deal. They got a year in juvinile hall and five years probation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A year. That's what your brother's life is worth. A damn year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so unaffected by this! How? Our son was murdered!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (measured) It was an accident, and the boys are juveniles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that makes it okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley storms out of the room. Jacob looks to his father, unnerved by the sight of his mother so upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim just turns and walks into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard awakens and silences the alarm.   He sits up in b for a moment and comes to his senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a sweat suit and sneakers, Leonard sprints dow the driveway and to the street. His sweat suit is so tigh Leonard looks like a stuffed sausage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With each step he takes, Leonard breathing becomes heavie and heavier. Sweat forms on his forehead and drips down h face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within seconds, Leonard's pace tapers off. He struggles t continue but is so out of shape, stopping is inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard leans over, gasping for air. He looks back and realizes that he only ran about one hundred yards. In fac his house is still in view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard turns around and starts walking back home.    Aft few steps, he stops and throws up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus stands inside of a shallow ditch, digging out the roo of an old tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus turns and sees Malee behind him, holding a PICNIC BAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Chung's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remembered. We were never introduced. My name is Malee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (CONT'D) (cont'd) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the mood for a picnic. I thought this would be a nice place to have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks around, confused. This location is anything but picnic friendly. Bulldozers plough through the scene, blasting exhaust into the air. Men scream at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole, move your fucking truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to join me?   There's plenty of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't go to lunch for another ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait. Meet me by the cement mixer when you're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee walks off. Gus watches as she makes her way through the construction site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Malee sit on a checkered blanket, eating Chinese with chopsticks. A large CEMENT MIXER stands behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I saw you, you had just come from a funeral. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Death is like so weird. I mean, it's sad, but I also feel like I've been given this sign. A sign which is telling me, life is short, so you gotta do what makes you happy. You gotta take chances. You gotta get crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to "get crazy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play the flute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah, that's totally nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not that. See, every year my school has this recital. I've always been too scared to play a solo in front of people, but this year I've decided to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. When is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I'm gonna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You can't go!    Nobody goes to these things. I don't even think my mom is going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta have somebody rooting for ya. Besides, I like music, and I owe you for bringing me lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, embarrassed) Okay. Tuesday at 8:30 in the junior high school auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vulnerable) Don't say it if you don't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.      Front row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee smiles.    She's got a major crush on Gus now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON TV: VIDEO GAME - HALO. Two soldiers fire at each other with supersonic weapons. One soldier is particularl annihilated. GAME OVER appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Jacob and Leonard in front of the TV. Malee off to side, reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe how much you suck at this game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob throws his remote down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (CONT'D) (cont'd) You wanna play again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys sit in silence for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna shoot some hoops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) The sentencing thing totally upset my mom. She was up half the night, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee closes her book, looks over at Leanord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it either. A year ain't shit! Rudy is dead forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want them dead. I want to kill them. I could handle a year in Juvy hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what those guys did was an accident. If you were to kill them, it's premedicated. You'd get 20 years to life at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm just supposed to sit here and take it? Be like you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem to have gone on with life pretty easily. Don't you miss him? Don't you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that we don't care.     It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does. You have to deal with it. If you don't, it could like eat you alive forever. 90 percent of people's problems is due to their inability to get over the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom tells that to all her patients. I've eavesdropped on some of her therapy sessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awesome. Can I listen in sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Anyway, she says, if a person wants closure, they gotta deal with their problems head on. Go see these guys and let them know how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think my parents would be up for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go alone. Juvy hall is only like forty minutes from here. Take the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jacob, thinking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door slowly opens. Jacob peeks his head insid the darkened room and quietly enters. He tip toes over to his parent's bed. Ashley lies asleep, wrapped up in a bun of blankets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob crosses to her night stand and opens the top drawer He removes her purse, unzips it and steals some cash, whi totals around 60 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sits in his chair, staring off into space.   Jacob en and crosses to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the help of the BUS DRIVER, Jacob loads his bike int the luggage compartment underneath the bus. Then he hands the driver a ticket and boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob takes a seat up front. After a few moments, the dri boards, starts the engine and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Kenny sit, staring at each other through a plat glass. Kenny picks up the ONE WAY PHONE. Jacob does also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jeff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick.     I think he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) I hate you. You know that?     You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy knew we were going to be there. He never should have come. You want the truth, all this happened cause of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you deformed retard! The only reason we started picking on you guys in the first place was because of that thing on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every night, I lie in bed and plan your murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I'm going to take a kitchen knife and chop off your fingers then your nose then your tongue. Then I'm gonna poke out your eyes with the end of a broomstick. Well, not really poke them out, but I'm gonna push them back into your brain. Then I'm gonna take scissors and cut off your ears. When they find you, it's gonna be like putting a jigsaw puzzle back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kill me, you come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? What do I have to look forward to? You've already destroyed my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no accidents. You're gonna pay for what you did. And it's gonna hurt like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard sits, reading through nutritional manuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that he is writing things down on a piece of paper The words written are: Sugar, corn syrup, salt, gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks through the hallway half asleep. She enters t kitchen and finds Leonard, sitting on the floor, surround by boxes of food. All of the kitchen cupboards are open a packages line the counter tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reading the list of ingredients in our foods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research. Do you know the damage these chemicals can do to the human body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, put everything back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is serious. You can't keep buying this crap. Don't you care that you're ingesting garbage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just put everything back and go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Leonard's look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee is riding her bike on the sidewalk when she sees Gu exit his car and enter her mother's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee runs up a flight of stairs. She gets off at the sec floor and enters an open, unoccupied office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee runs over to the heating grate and puts her ear to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same. Still can't sleep. When I do, nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco and Gus sit across from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post traumatic stress is very common in your line of work. Many fire fighters go through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But why now? I haven't fought fires in ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes we experience something so horrific, our memory blocks it out. That way we won't have to relive the pain. It's called repression. Our bodies are not so forgiving, however. Inside, we feel the effects of trauma even when we don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something stirred your unconscious. If we find out what that was, we can begin the healing process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks to her, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) You told me last week, the nightmares started about the time you moved here. Let's look at that. Why did you move here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend was making good money with construction. He got an offer to build that extension off Lindsay Acres. He suggested I come into town and work for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee is on the edge of her seat, listening. We see that has written the following words in her notebook: GUS - NIGHTMARES - FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any other reoccurring elements in your dreams. Perhaps, a face or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Light my Fire" is always playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light my fire. The Doors song. (singing) "Da da something... wallow in the mire... Da, da... we couldn't get much higher. Come on baby light my fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco stares at Gus.    He is suddenly self conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee circles the words "Light My Fire" again and again a again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: CLANGING POTS AND PANS, coming from downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob exits his room and goes to inspect the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands on a chair, cleaning out the kitchen cupboards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pots and pans line the counter tops, dishes cover the tab and non perishable foods are spread out across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters and is taken aback by the sight of Jim stand on a chair and wearing an APRON and RUBBER GLOVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim rips the rubber gloves off with his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM (CONT'D) (cont'd) You know, for the past few weeks, I sat in this house. I couldn't move. Everything reminded me of Rudy. Then from out of nowhere I had a revelation. I am alive! Your mother is alive! I became overcome with joy because I realized how lucky we are to still have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob.   I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim grabs Jacob and hugs him tightly.    Jacob pulls away unsettled and bit frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM (CONT'D) (cont'd) (half crazed) I went to work today. For the first time in weeks. It was as if I had just gotten out of college! I was fearless! I went after accounts I had avoided for years because I thought they were out of my league. I spoke to presidents, vice presidents, business managers, sales reps. I was amazing. I was magic. But when I came home to share the news with your mother, I discovered her asleep. When I looked around the house, I realized that her "office", for lack of a better word, was also piled up. So, I took to the house. I have made it my duty to clean this place from top to bottom. Even if it takes me all night, I don't care. Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join me? Join me in this celebration of life. A symbolic gesture of cleaning out the old and bringing in the new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown for a loop) No, you don't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jim's look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents and students file inside. A large SIGN above the door reads, JEFFERSON JUNIOR HIGH FALL RECITAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed audience listens to A GIRL (12), standing center stage and singing "The Rose". She is not nearly as good a she thinks she is, but she sings full throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FIND Malee, sitting in the flute section and playing a with the rest of the orchestra. She looks to the front ro but Gus is no where to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl finishes her song, and the crowd politely applau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Farmer crosses to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure Bette Midler would be most impressed with that rendition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd laughs.   Mr. Farmer didn't mean for it to be a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. FARMER (CONT'D) (cont'd) Anyway, our next soloist is Malee Chung. She will play the theme from "Love Story" on the flute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd applauds as Malee rises and crosses to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Farmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee spots Gus, walking down the aisle. He scurries into the front row and sits. Malee lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) There's actually been a change. I'm not going to play the theme from "Love Story". Um... this is a song...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Farmer, waves to Malee from off stage.   Malee looks him. Mr. Farmer mouths something to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mr. Farmer) What? I can't hear you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Farmer throws up his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Anyway.    This is a song by The Doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the mention of The Doors, Gus' smile instantly fades. coincidence is just too great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee starts to play "Light My Fire". She is good. Mr. Farmer and the audience seem pleased by her euphonious performance. Even Gus is won over. He appears entranced b the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recital is over. Most of the audience has filed out. few remain, offering their congratulations to the musicia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee stands with Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jacob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't make it. He...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee spots Gus, heading towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!     He's coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!     Leave now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee pushes Leonard behind her just as Gus approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Be honest. I'd rather you tell me I sucked then lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard peeks around Malee's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee turns around and pinches Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow, ow, ow alright.    I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard walks off. Malee turns back around with a big smi on her face. She plays coy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you really enjoyed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good song.      What made you pick it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering) Oh, uh... my mother was humming it all last week. Big Doors fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Is she here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She missed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, I have to go, but thanks again. I had a great time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus gives Malee an innocent kiss on the check and then wa off. Malee melts. She stands frozen, clutching onto her flute in ecstacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With fire and determination, Leonard jogs. Unfortunately, is quickly winded by the run. He bends over, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERIMPOSE SHOT OVER SHOT: Leonard appears, running past his old, weaker self. Stronger, he makes a few more yards and then is forced to stop.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He leans over for air, and we SUPERIMPOSE another SHOT OV SHOT of Leonard, weeks later, running past his weaker sel (This series of shots repeats a few more times, illustrat the progression of time and weight loss.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard runs up and down the stairs, sweating like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace appears, watching him around the corner.     She sh her head and then returns to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That boy is going to bring the entire house down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him be. He's looking good. I'm proud of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls) Girls, have you decided what you're going to go as for Halloween?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either a witch or a princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Haley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go as a marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, a marble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, like a bag of marbles, but just one marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Jeff sit across from each other on the phone. J has two black eyes and a fat lip. He is crying profusely. Jacob doesn't appear at all sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, man.   I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just think about what I said. Get out of my sight. And send Kenny in on your way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff rises and walks to a door, leading to the jail. A moment later, Kenny enters, looking pissed off. He sits across from Jacob and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd both like to know that Halloween was Rudy's favorite holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob picks up some pictures and presses them against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB (CONT'D) (cont'd) These are pictures from every single Halloween since we were five. You see how happy he was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we'd go trick or treating, we'd sit in our room and swap the candy we hated. Rudy loved Snickers, I Almond Joys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almond Joy sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sucks is that I'll never get to sit in my room and swap candy with my brother ever again. Thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To remind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could we forget? You been coming here for months to "remind us".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is forcing you to talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything to get out of my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your cell small?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is a coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the only one who wishes he was still alive. I'd do anything to bring him back, but I can't. It's not easy being in here. Hell, you saw Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pissed off the wrong guy off. Jeff is totally fucked right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come back here ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free country. I'll come if I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't expect me to show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny slams down the phone and exits.   Jacob smiles, hav shaken him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace hands out candy to a few trick or treaters at her d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful now.   Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace crosses to the kitchen table where Pat is doing a crossword puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids keep coming later every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: FRONT DOOR, opening and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley and Sara storm into the kitchen in tears. Haley is dressed as a MARBLE, and Sara is dressed as a WITCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him! I hate him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?    What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard! He threw away all our Halloween candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabbed our bags and just threw them down a gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard enters.   Haley and Sara run out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? Why did you throw away their candy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because their sugar intake is completely unhealthy. Besides, Halloween is supposed to be a celebration of evil. How did candy get wrapped into it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to ask you this once, and I want a straight answer. Are you in a cult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what happens when kids join cults. The first thing they change is their diets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not in a cult. This is all information you can find in books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The issue here is that you have stolen one of the most exciting nights of the year from your sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anybody had done this to you when you were a child, we never would have heard the end of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish somebody had done it to me. I wish either one of you had given a shit about my weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard storms out of the kitchen.    Patrick and Grace a speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard lies on the floor, doing sit-ups.       He can ac a few now. Patrick bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not care for your language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only trying to help you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard stops exercising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (cont'd) You're fat dad. Mom is fat.   Us kids are fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you and mom are going to die young if you keep eating as poorly as you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this obsession you have with weight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coach for Jefferson High is also my gym teacher. He told me that if I got into shape, I could start as center for the Freshman team when I get to high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center is a great position. Toughest guy on the field. A good center can make or break a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   That's why I'm trying so hard to get into shape. You guys should to. At the rate you're going, you won't make it to your 60's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Leonard. Your mom, to her, a tasty meal is just a way of showing she cares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't! Tonight she served spaghetti and meatballs from a can. The amount of sodium alone can wreck havoc on a person's blood pressure. Not to mention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, people just don't drop dead from eating meatballs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Leonard's look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee hands Gus her bag of Halloween Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take your Halloween candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be doing me a favor. Chocolate gives you zits. Besides, if I want to keep this firm ass as an adult, I gotta develop good eating habits now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Maybe just a snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus opens a snickers bar and starts eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So work is good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest, I can't wait till this job is finished. This place is creepy. You know, a boy died here like right before we started working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy.   His name was Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was one of my best friends. Remember that funeral I went to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you knew. Two boys threw a flaming cocktail at him. Can you imagine killing someone like that? How evil can you get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus eyes Malee, completely unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously drunk, Gus stumbles to his front door.   He fum for his keys and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus lies in bed with a bottle of whiskey in one hand and GUN in the other. Distraught and at the point of tears, G opens the chamber and loads the gun with a single bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he spins the chamber and locks it. Gus puts the gun his head and fires. NOTHING. He throws the gun across the room, grabs the bottle of whiskey and drinks it till it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley stands with a big smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Laskey is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Jacob look up, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He committed suicide in his jail cell last night. Sally Yngve called just now to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Jacob sit, stunned. Their shock turns to intrigue Ashley, appearing unaffected by the news, crosses to the kitchen table, opens a nearby box of donuts and begins eating. She is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you smiling?    A boy died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, a monster that murdered my son died. Justice is served; end of story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley crosses to the kitchen sink. She rolls up her slee and begins cleaning. Jim crosses over to her and they kis as if nothing happened. Jacob is baffled by their behavio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Kenny are on the phone together. Kenny looks ga and tired. Jeff's death has obviously affected him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used his bed sheet, waited until lights out and then jumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His cell mate let him hang there the entire night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you even give a shit. I bet when you heard, you started dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew he wouldn't make it. It's my fault too. Jeff wasn't a saint when I met him, but he sure as hell wasn't headed here. (tearing up) That fucking asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny drops the phone and begins crying in his arms. Jaco watches through the glass, touched by Kenny's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits on the floor, surrounded by boxes and wrapping paper. Santa has obviously been good to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sits on the couch, drifting in and out of sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley, dressed in her finest Christmas sweater, peruses fireplace mantel and all of the decorations that line it. She is a drastically different woman than the last time w saw her. She looks upbeat and pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IPOD!   Sweet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley looks at Jacob and smiles.    He has just unwrappe IPOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.     You guys went crazy this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley smiles at her son. It's a bittersweet moment for h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, Jacob still has one more present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were going to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, do it now! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley crosses to the couch and sits beside Jim.    They each others hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After serious debate, your father and I have decided... to adopt A BABY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna adopt a baby. Hopefully a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jacob's shock -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard's extended    family sits at the kitchen table, e Christmas dinner.     His extended family is just as over as his immediate.     Leonard barely touches his own plat disgusted to eat.     He rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I be excused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family stops eating and turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard sits back down.    His family quickly resumes eat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee does her homework, Yacoo flips through a fashion magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to do this? It's Christmas break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be one step ahead in January.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because you're an atheist, I don't get to celebrate the holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco shoots Malee the look of death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Don't you find it hard not believing in anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going for a bike ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a foot of snow outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are ploughed. Besides, I like looking at all the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be home in an hour. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee flips through a TELEPHONE BOOK.      She comes to G and rips out the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee knocks on Gus' door, but he doesn't answer. Then Ma spots a WELCOME MAT. She kicks it aside and discovers a SPARE KEY underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee cautiously enters, shutting the door behind her. A beat. She allows the excitement to settle in. It's your typical bachelor pad. Stray beer bottles decorate every shelf and end table. Dirty clothes drape across an old couch. Malee continues on to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee finds the kitchen more of a mess than the living ro Pots, pans and stacks of TV dinners line the counter top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee enters and stops cold at the sight of the bed. Its unmade and the sheets and blankets are entangled in a bal Aroused, Malee sits on the bed and then lies back in ecst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives up, parks along the sidewalk, and gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee goes through a photo album. We see pictures of Gus, dressed in a firefighter's uniform. He appears much young and clean cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Malee returns the album to the night stand, she notice an open drawer and peeks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus lazily makes his way upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee holds Gus' gun. Complete with sound effects, she pretends to shoot a beer bottle off the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee laughs and then jumps across the bed like a Charlie Angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus fumbles for his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee stands in front of the mirror, posing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!   That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee laughs in spite of herself. In the process, she unknowingly cocks the trigger.   Malee places the gun to forehead and pretends to shoot herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON TRIGGER, a hair away from firing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loud bang we heard was the front door slamming shut. opens it and inspects the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus removes a beer from the fridge. We follow him into hi bedroom. He stops cold as if feeling the presence of some one else there, but Malee is nowhere to be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus begins getting undressed. We follow his shirt to the floor and SEE Malee, hiding underneath his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee looks out from underneath the bed. She watches as t now naked Gus enters the shower stall in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the water falls upon Gus, Malee rises from underneath bed and crosses over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From over Gus's shoulder, we see Malee approaching. An in away from Gus, Malee reaches out her hand to touch him. Suddenly, Gus breaks down and starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsettled, Malee slowly retreats out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee, Leonard and Jacob sit, playing LIFE, the board gam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, white male infants are the hardest to come by. 60 minutes did a whole story on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you watch 60 minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was in the hospital. They said, any adoption agency worth its salt has at least a three year waiting list. By the time your parents get a kid, you'll be in college. You think they'll want to start over again with that baby shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's like they're trying to replace Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter cause it's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee has been silent this entire time.    Seeing a momen speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirsty. (to Leanard) Can you get us some drinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's the gentlemanly thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you all of a sudden going to get the drinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitchy) Because you've upset me, and I don't want to see you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard looks to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll get the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard exits.   Malee turns to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a favor. It's big. I need you to hide something for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee reaches into her back pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise, you won't freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee removes Gus' gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB (cont'd) Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, you wouldn't freak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you. I just need you to hide it for a while. When all is cool, I'll come for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you keep it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother is a total snoop. She goes through my stuff like all the time. (beat) Please, Jacob. Somebody's life might depend on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob crosses to his closet, removes his metal LOCK BOX a opens it. Jacob takes the gun and places it inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it loaded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I do have some bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee reaches into her backpack and removes the bullets. Jacob takes them out and puts them in the lock box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Sure your parents won't find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody has the combination, but me. Besides, I could be building a bomb in here, and they wouldn't even know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Jacob, locking the box up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON TWO FEET, running. We REVEAL that it's LEONARD. His on skin tight sweat suit, hangs off of him. More than just skinny, Leonard is in perfect shape. He runs fast, carefu avoiding puddles of melting snow. (Spring is fast on the horizon.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Kenny talk via one way phone. Their demeanor ha changed since last we saw them. No longer fraught with contempt and acrimony, they speak like two old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent in some comics for ya.   The X-men one is pretty sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That last batch was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get going, I don't want to miss my bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you go, I got some news. Apparently, the parole board feels I've been a model prisoner, so they're giving me early release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   How can they do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They just did. You're pissed, aren't you? I knew you would be. (off Jacob's silence) It was an accident, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're getting out.   Gonna head back to school, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck school. I'm going to live with my Dad in New Mexico. He's working on a ranch out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave the state. That violates your probation. You'll have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad won't tell anyone. No one will even care I'm out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, in the entire time I've been locked up, you were the only one who came to see me. Trust me, she won't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee fans out a fist full of twenty dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 dollars! Dad sent me 200 dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco, smiling, gets ready for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) I have to call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (covering) Your father... went out.     He's not home right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee eyes her mother, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting weird.     What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you want to come with me to the mall and spend it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer it if you'd put that money in the bank. (off Malee's look) Fine, spend it. You'll have to do it alone though. I have a patient this afternoon. Have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco exits the kitchen.     Malee looks at her cash and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, Patrick and Grace sit at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. You know how my company flies me to Florida every April?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I have been going since I was eight. It's the guy's week off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This year, I'm taking the girls. Just the girls. You're staying home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we all go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying here all alone. Besides, you said it yourself, you've been going for years. Give your sisters a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard eyes his mother with hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. (beat) I need money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes.    Nothing I have fits anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and I aren't rich. You can't get a new wardrobe anytime you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do, go to school naked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wear a belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give him some cash, he can get some clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's gonna gain all his weight back in a few months.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) Then what, we have to buy him new clothes all over again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously hurt, Leonard storms out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hated going to Florida?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard and Jacob play catch with a football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was fat. Now I don't have to wear a T-shirt when I go swimming. Who knows, maybe I could even get lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still ugly, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard punches Jacob's arm in fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what my mother's problem is. It's like the thinner I get, the more she hates me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably jealous. Maybe you should put her on that diet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime I mention it, my mother goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you really want her to drop a few tons, put her in jail. Kenny's lost about 30 pounds since he's been incarcerated, and he was already thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Jail is the perfect weight loss program. You take a fat tub, throw them in a room and force them to eat right and exercise. Don't let them out till they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Leonard, thinking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco enters Malee's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee, dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco notices a number of department store bags strewn everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (cont'd) Malee? (noticing something) Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL MALEE, standing across the room. She is no longer gawky, adolescent girl. Rather, she has been transformed into a beautiful young woman. Her glasses have been repla by contacts, and her braided pig tails by a quaff of chin length curls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a new look. You know, for Spring. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee spins around, giving Yacco the full picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different. What happened to your glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contacts. It took me like forty five minutes to get them in, but beauty is pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, in the future, I'd like to know if you're going to radically change your appearance. Clean your stuff up and come down for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco exits.    Malee looks in the mirror, deflated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus watches a CEMENT TRUCK, dumping cement into a foundat Once the cement is poured, the truck pulls forward. Malee revealed, standing there and holding a picnic basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus sees the new and improved Malee for the first time. jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee?   My God, you look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.     You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Malee's smile -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Malee eat their lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like I needed a change, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're driving the boys at school wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys my age are so immature. I'm more attracted to older gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee smiles at Gus.       He knows where this is going, suddenly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want somebody that much older than you. An age difference can cause problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of times when a couple has an age difference, they wind up splitting up because they want different things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus catches a look of relief on Malee's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (cont'd) I mean, yeah. You may be 13, but a boy even three years older than you is probably more "experienced". Boys can be impatient about that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you impatient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you have a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, but it didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old was she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About my age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that, age wasn't an issue, yet you still wanted different things. I don't think it's about age.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MALEE (cont'd) I think when two people connect, they connect for other reasons. And since soulmates are eternal, they have no age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus is stumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard watches Patrick and his sisters drive off in a TAXICAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after them) Have a good flight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxicab disappears down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leonard turns back around, he sees Grace, staring at h from the window. They lock eyes for a moment and then Gra disappears into the dark recesses of the home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard descends the staircase and begins looking around the setting. Boxes of junk clutter the floor along with o furniture and bicycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the basement door, which leads out to the backyard. As Leonard unlocks and opens the door, a mass o cobwebs stretch across the frame like elastic bands. Leon grabs a nearby broom and starts wiping away the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits at his desk, reading the PLASTIC SURGERY PAMPH his parents had given him for his birthday last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom door opens and Ashley sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you come downstairs for a minute. We have a surprise for you.
