dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stands in front of KEITH GARDNER (10), African American, sweet faced and dressed in a shirt and tie.   H luggage with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley and Jim stand behind the boys, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Keith Gardner. You're new brother. Keith our son, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob leads Keith inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get top bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of afraid of heights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks to be you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith lets Jacob's attitude pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB (CONT'D) (cont'd) No offence, but I never thought my future brother would be a... well, a "brother".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought my future brother would have a KOOL AID stain, smeared across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, it's a birthmark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting off on the wrong foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my parents said they were taking in an orphan, I pictured a baby. So what happened, your parents die or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was given up at birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna try and find your mother when you're 18?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I'm concerned, the fact she had me was enough. I don't need to show up one day and disrupt her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but it's okay to just show up one day and disrupt mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Keith's hurt look -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee stands at the card catalogue, flipping through the section. She comes to cards with the word SEX in the titl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee enters her room, locks the door behind her and empt her bag of SEX books on the bed. The first one she peruse is the "KARMA SUTRA". At first glance, Malee's eyes go wi in shock. She grabs her backpack and removes a number of index cards. Malee starts taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is on the one way phone with Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not some baby.   He's like 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blaming me for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   But can you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is the only way they can get over Rudy's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a person not a fucking vase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get out of there. I can't live in that house for one more day. I want to go with you to New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. You've never even   been out on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy. After first night falls, you'll be pissing yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need me to run away from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. (beat) And you want to come with ME of all people. Are you forgetting, I was the one who killed Rudy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny appears stunned.    Jacob has never accepted that t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB (CONT'D) (cont'd) I'll be helpful. I can get everything we'll need together. As soon as you're released, we can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny appears to be weighing the decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB (CONT'D) (cont'd) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is what you want.   Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco is on the phone with her ex-husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm not asking for much. Just call her from time to time... Because she needs to know her father cares... Call collect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee enters the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Dad? Can I talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some responsibility for yourself and grow... Hello?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YACCO (CONT'D) (cont'd) He hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you expect?   All you ever do is yell at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee, you don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my Dad! I'm sorry if it bothers you, but I love him. You keep this up then one day, when I'm old enough, I'll leave here and go and stay with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee runs out of the room, leaving a disappointed Yacco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard hammers a piece of wood over the basement door, w is now entirely boarded up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL the basement. Now clean. Boxes, furniture and tras are piled neatly in a corner. Only a mattress remains on floor in the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard grabs a grocery bag and crosses to a bathroom at opposite end of the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard turns on the light, revealing a shower, toilet an sink. He removes toiletries from the grocery bag and plac them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace watches FAMILY FEUD while eating cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Help! Oh God, Ma! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace drops her fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace jumps up and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace opens the door to the staircase, which leads to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Leonard, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on top of me. I can't get up! Oh, there's so much blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling 9-1-1!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off me first! I'm bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go downstairs, I won't be able to make it back up. Let me call 9-1-1 first, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard doesn't answer her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace begins walking downstairs. Due to her size, she has difficultly maneuvering through the tight space. Her inability to see her feet isn't helping matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace makes it downstairs, but Leonard is nowhere in sigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Leonard bursts through the bathroom door with a hammer in hand. He runs past Grace and up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half way up the stairs, Leonard stops and pries two of th steps off the stair case with his hammer. This creates a GAP, making it virtually impossible for Grace to ascend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) What are you doing? I can't climb up now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard runs upstairs and slams the door after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard!     Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee watches as Gus enters his car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee crosses to Gus' door with a GROCERY BAG in hand. Sh kicks the welcome mat aside, picks up the spare key and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee enters and removes a pair of rubber gloves, a bottl ammonia and trash bags. She starts cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard descends the staircase, holding a tray of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace instantly rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope someone is hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No joke, Ma. For the next two weeks while Dad and the girls are away, you will be kept down here. I'll provide you with nutritious meals and plenty of water. You, mother, will learn what it means to be healthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what this is about, food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to save your life, mom. Trying to give you a life. Cause I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life is fine.   I don't need you to "save me".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard looks at his mother, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even realize how sick you are. It's a problem when an otherwise healthy woman can't drag her ass up a flight of stairs because she's so obese. You're staying down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard turns and crosses back to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEONARD (CONT'D) (cont'd) Oh, and no cigarettes either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is now spotless. Malee removes TWO TV DINNERS from the oven. She crosses over to the kitchen table and places the food onto plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table is set to the nines. A small candle burns in th center. Once the table is set and the food served, Malee takes a step back and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee strips off her clothes and puts on a long, silk rob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives up, gets out of his car and enters the buildin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus approaches his door. As he takes out his key, he noti that the welcome mat has been pushed off to the side. Gus lifts the mat up and sees that his spare key is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus enters.   He knows someone else is in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow him into the kitchen and FIND MALEE, standing beside the table and dressed only in her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (CONT'D) (cont'd) What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made dinner, my love.   And I have a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been in my apartment before, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee drops her robe, revealing her naked body.    Gus qu looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (CONT'D) (cont'd) Malee, put your clothes on now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you like my body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee starts walking towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee, stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay because I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus doesn't answer. Malee is right behind him now.     Sh her head on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Touch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus slowly turns around and looks at Malee for a long, pregnant beat. It's a tense moment, and we are unsure of what he's going to do. Then Gus moves past her and crosse to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (cont'd) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go call your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus exits.    Malee stands the fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're soulmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now embarrassed and crushed, she starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee, now wrapped in a large overcoat, is led by Yacco o of the building and over to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco and Malee sit in silence.      After a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob shoves clothes into his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith enters with Rudy's baseball glove on his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna play some catch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob notices the glove. He rushes over to Keith, yanks i off his hand and pushes Keith to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet. Ow, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith struggles to get free, but Jacob is too strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEITH (CONT'D) (cont'd) You're hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I say you could play with the glove? Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything, and I mean, EVERYTHING in this room is mine. You are not allowed to touch a thing, especially the glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob gets off of Keith and crosses to his closet. He pul out the lock box, unlocks it and removes the gun. He poin it at Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you tell my parents what I said, I'll kill you. I'll shoot you in the fucking face, I swear it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith nods, petrified. Jacob puts the gun back in the loc box, throws it in the closet and storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley sits at the kitchen table, looking at a picture of Rudy and Jacob when they were infants. Her eyes are fille but she's not crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob enters and crosses to the fridge.      He spots Ash is taken aback by her state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) What's wrong now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking at a picture of you and Rudy when you were born. God, I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have Keith now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley is struck by Jacob's comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have Keith. Two boys again. Everything is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't adopt Keith to replace Rudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your information, your father and I discussed adopting for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Right. Maybe if it was me who died, you wouldn't need another kid to get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that? I never wanted either of my children to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one of us did. If you had to choose which one, I bet you wish it was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think we favored Rudy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did!    Admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admit he was easier to raise, but we didn't love him more. Jacob, listen to me. You came with a different set of challenges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My birthmark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy being different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) I'm not different!! You always made me feel like something was wrong. There's nothing wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't! It's like you don't know how to deal with me. You never did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if that is how you feel. You do the best you can as a parent. You don't always know what's right. But you're my son. I'd do anything for you. I'd fight for you, I'd kill for you, I'd die for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy used to say that exact same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. And as unchristian as it sounds, I still want the boy that killed Rudy dead. Someday, when you grow up, you'll understand what I mean. Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace exits the bathroom and begins walking around the basement, looking for a way out. She crosses to the board up door and tries to pull the boards off. Unsuccessful, s returns to the bed and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Grace spots the tray of food, which is stil untouched. Angry and disgusted, she takes it and throws i at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace paces nervously while blabbering to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Pat calls, and I don't answer, he'll know something is wrong. He'll know. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace nervously rocks back and forth. Sweat covers her bo She glances at the tray of food, which rests on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace stands at the base of the stairwell, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this door now! Let me out, God damn it! Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is crying. She catches sight of the meal that she threw on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, Grace crawls over to it and starts shoving down her throat. She doesn't seem bothered by the fact th her dinner is covered with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco exits her office to find Gus waiting for his sessio They speak not a word. He rises and enters the office. Sh follows, shutting the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Yacco sit in their respective seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we begin, I want to apologize. I should have known what was going on with Malee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I knew she had a crush on me. I guess, I felt bad for her. She's a very unhappy girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco looks down, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (CONT'D) (cont'd) If it's any consolation, the whole thing was very "therapeutic" for me. (off Yacco's look) Sorry. That was a very selfish thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your therapy. Not mine. Why was it therapeutic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slept last night. I can't remember the last time I slept so deep or so sound. I don't remember dreaming or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the last fires I ever fought was a brownstone, beautiful. The place was burned from roof to basement. Whole family was wiped out. When I was upstairs, inspecting, I found a girl. She couldn't have been more than 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUS (cont'd) The whole right side of her face was burnt off, but her eyes were open. She was alive. The pain must have been excruciating. She was begging for me to... kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly what she wanted. I placed my hand over her mouth and what was left of her nose, and I... I killed her. I told myself it was the right thing to do, but I've never been sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this have to do with Malee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I saw her last night, she had the same look on her face as that girl. She just wanted me to take away her pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco sits, pondering all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUS (CONT'D) (cont'd) Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if we... cut out early today? No charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus rises and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco sits alone and starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard is at the kitchen sink, arranging a fruit salad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY, he hears the sound of water boiling over from t stove. Leonard quickly turns the gas low, extinguishing t flame. He removes the pot from the burner, grabs a strain and removes poached EGG WHITES from the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard grabs a dish towel and begins wiping the water of the stove. Preoccupied, he doesn't realize that when he wipes the oven knob dry, he turns the gas on high. (Since the overflowing water, extinguished the pilot light, he i unaware that gas is now being emitted from the burner.) his condition, HE WON'T BE ABLE TO SMELL IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard grabs the plates of food and exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard places the food by Grace's bed.    She is sleepin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard sits on the couch, watching TV. Suddenly, he star coughing, hard. The fit subsides and Leonard resumes watching TV, thinking nothing of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee enters the kitchen and answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?... Daddy!... No, she's not home... Can I ask you something? Can I visit you for a while?... A week... But I can fly alone... No, I understand... Yeah... I love y... Hello?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee hangs up the phone. Tears swell in her eyes.     Sh places her head in her arms and start bawling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee looks to find Yacco standing behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her tears) Why does he hate me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yacco walks to Malee and hugs her tight.    It's a long, overdue hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace awakens from her nap.     Suddenly, she sniffs at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace rises and crosses over to the foot of the basement stairs. She sees that the upstairs door is wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard, I smell gas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard is slumped over, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace coughs hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, don't you smell that...? (sotto) Oh God, he can't. Leonard! Leonard, the gas is on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace grabs a hold of the railing and starts climbing the stairs. After a few steps, she stops to rest, wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the help of the railing, Grace pulls herself up to t GAP in the staircase. In one forceful exertion, she prope her body up and forward. The railing instantly becomes separated from the wall. Grace lands in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily, the top half of her body made it to the other si With all of her might, Grace pulls herself up to the land

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted and wheezing, Grace drags herself over to the s and shuts the gas off. She looks around for Leonard and s him in the living room, slumped over and unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace frantically shuffles over to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Leonard, wake up! Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard slowly comes to in a hospital bed.       The same from earlier is by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom, she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine. They've taken her into surgery. She blew out her knees somehow. We're trying to get your father on the phone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. You need your rest. Everything is fine now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob straddles his bike, watching a crew spread cement o the foundation of a house. Jacob appears lost in thought. He looks at a picture of Rudy and himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob touches his face in the photograph. He traces his finger along the outline of his birthmark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, we ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Kenny share a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got sleeping bags, a tent, canteens and a lantern.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KENNY (cont'd) I heard it's supposed to rain, so I'll bring ponchos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half hearted) Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny eyes Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting weird.    You gonna chicken out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not. I already packed twice the amount of shit. I can't carry it all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm telling you, man. It's gonna be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You can't be a pussy all your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, hauntingly) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tonight.    Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny rides off. Jacob watches him go.       He has a lif almost calculating look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace lies in a hosptial bed, watching TV. Leonard enters dressed in a hospital gown. Grace turns to him, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, mom. I didn't mean to leave the gas on. It was an accident. And everything that happened, I... I just thought that maybe, I could help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, my mother died at 52. We had to cremate her body because they didn't make a coffin big enough for her to fit in. Even if they had, no one could have carried it. (tearing up) I loved her so much. I don't want that to happen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if I can manage the food... Can you honestly see me, running a marathon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to run a marathon. You just have to run to the end of the block. It's not so hard as you think it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard leans over and kisses his mother's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRACE (cont'd) I spoke to your father. He and the girls caught a flight. They should be here by morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him there was a gas leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you meant. I didn't tell him. I don't think I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob lies awake, staring out the window.     A heavy win blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits up and silences his watch alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith awakens as well, but remains silent. He watches as Jacob grabs a bag and exits the house through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he's gone, Keith gets off the top bunk, crosses to t window and watches as Jacob runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, Keith crosses to the closet. He removes the lock box and begins trying combinations to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy rain begins to fall as Jacob rides up. He sees Kenny, standing inside of a partially, constructed house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny throws Jacob a PONCHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob removes his backpack and puts on the poncho. Then h opens his backpack and removes his HOCKEY MASK. (The same mask he was wearing at the beginning of the movie.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNY (CONT'D) (cont'd) What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If people see me riding around in the middle of the night, we're screwed. You didn't bring a disguise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit what I'm up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys start riding off in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNY (CONT'D) (cont'd) The main road is this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but if we cut through the construction site, we'll hit the railroad tracks. It's faster and no one will bother us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny files in behind Jacob, and the boys make their way into the construction site. Thunder and lightning crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith has forgone opening the lock box via a combination now tries to pry the top open with a SCREWDRIVER. He work frantically, fearing Jacob's return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Henry make their way to the edge of the construction site. Suddenly, Jacob stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob lifts the hockey mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob begins rummaging through his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith pries the box open.       It's EMPTY.   No gun or b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! I knew it.     I knew you'd chicken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob rises, holding the gun.   He points it at Kenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KENNY (CONT'D) (cont'd) What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob shakes, frightened and reluctant to do what he beli he has to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you leave, Kenny.     You have to pay for what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa hold on. Alright, I... I won't go. I'll stay here. I'll do my probation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob cocks the gun.   Tears stream down his checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him. I gotta do this... for my family. It's the only way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, I told ya, it... it was an accident. I swear. Please, don't. This isn't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I can't be a pussy all my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob fires. Kenny is hit in the head.      He drops to t ground instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The force of the gun, knocks Jacob to the ground.      As falls, the hockey mask comes down over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits for a beat, staring at Kenny's lifeless body. Lightning flashes, illuminating his blue eyes through the hockey mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is inside one of the UNPAVED house foundations, dig a hole. He cries, struggling to finish what he has done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a hole is dug, Jacob throws Kenny's body inside and starts covering it up with dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob climbs through his window, soaking wet. He crosses his closet and begins to change. Keith lies in bed, watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob removes the gun from his pocket and places it back inside the lock box. His hands shake violently. As he put the box back inside the closet. He finds Rudy's glove. He smells the leather and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob takes the glove and crosses over to his bed.    He the glove beside Keith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I wasn't supposed to touch this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours. Just don't leave it outside. If it gets wet, the leather will crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take good care of it.   I know this was Rudy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob lies down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KEITH (cont'd) Why do you have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a b-b gun. I returned it to a friend of mine. (beat) I'm sorry for being such an asshole to ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean we're brothers now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, torn apart) Yeah. We're brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith lies back in bed, smiling. Jacob rolls over, still unnerved by what he is done. He'll never be the same, and knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus loads cinder blocks into a wheel barrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus spins around, and finds Malee, standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Before you freak out, I want to tell you, I'm sorry. And to give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee opens her backpack and removes Gus' GUN.    Gus sna it from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be mad. I was just worried about you. Now I'm out of your life forever. Goodbye. Thanks for not pressing any charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee walks off.      Gus holds the gun in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON JACOB, staring at the construction site.    We Z OUT and find him, straddling his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee appears, walking over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a storm last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand for a moment, watching the builders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (cont'd) Did you hear about Leonard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob nods, YES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (cont'd) Only him. I was gonna go and visit him at the hospital. You want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob doesn't answer. He is preoccupied with watching a TRUCK pour cement into the foundation where Kenny is buri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bittersweet moment. While relieved by the fact tha his crime will be hidden, the guilt overwhelms him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (cont'd) Earth to Jacob. You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob turns his bike around, and the two ride off togethe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your birthday's coming up. Any hints as to what you might like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you get me will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malee eyes Jacob, sensing that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALEE (CONT'D) (cont'd) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) Never better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK ON the foundation. Gus enters frame and begins spreading cement over Kenny's grave.
